p: Several species of the Lamiaceae family have been studied for the development of novel chemotherapeutic agents [ 56, 57, 58]. Herein, the methanol and water extracts were tested with HepG2, human hepatocarcinoma cells ( Table 6). Hepatocellular carcinoma, the most common liver malignancy, is a leading cause of cancer-related death worldwide [ 58]. In this work, the methanol extract of N. baytopii aerial parts showed high cytotoxicity (31.7%) against HepG2 while water was non-cytotoxic. Melanoma is a type of skin cancer occurring in melanocytes, which are dendritic-like cells producing melanin pigment [ 59]. We observed that the water extract (70.2%) showed higher cytotoxicity against mouse melanoma cell (B16 4A5). We also determined the cytotoxic effect of N. baytopii aerial parts against non-tumoral murine bone marrow stromal, and the results are presented in Table 7. The methanol extract (34.8%) was more cytotoxic than the water extract (61.5%). In the literature, in accordance with the presented results, several Nepeta species, such as N. curvidens [ 60], N. curviflora [ 61], and N. nuda [ 22] exhibited remarkable cytotoxic effects on several cell lines.
